#Text=Organize
#Text=Yourself for the Day Ahead
#Text=A hectic morning can throw off your whole day .
#Text=Not only can it be stressful to be rushed in the morning , but being rushed to lead to mistakes .

#Text=Perhaps on your way to run out the door , you forget an important file for work or , worse yet , your coffee ! Getting organized the night before can lead to fewer mistakes and a less stressful morning .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Staging your Morning
#Text=Pack your lunch the night before .
#Text=Classic easy lunches that will keep overnight include sandwiches , salads , and leftovers .
#Text=Put a note on your refrigerator so that you remember to grab it when you open your refrigerator at breakfast .
#Text=Create a space for essentials .
#Text=Pick a spot where you ’ll always put your keys , wallet , pocket change and anything else you always want to have with you .
#Text=Make a habit of putting your things there as soon as you come home , and picking them up from there as you leave .
#Text=Leave yourself a note by the door .
#Text=Maybe you charge your phone at night on your bedside table .
#Text=Leave a note by all the other things at your door that you will take with you .
#Text=Use sticky notes or even something more attractive , such as a chalk board .
#Text=Set the timer on your coffee maker .
#Text=Even the most basic coffee makers have timers .
#Text=Just pour the grounds into the filter before you go to bed , and you can wake up , get your coffee fix without the time wasted waiting or preparing it .
#Text=It 's like your own little robotic barista .
#Text=Set the table for your breakfast .
#Text=Shave a couple more minutes off your morning prep time by deciding what you ’ll eat in the morning and getting however much of it ready as you can the night before .
#Text=Tidy up .
#Text=Give yourself a clean start to the day .
#Text=Do the dishes , sweep , clear off tables and desks .
#Text=Not only will clearing clutter from your house clear your mind , it will also make everything easier to find in those precious morning moments .
#Text=Picking
#Text=What You ’ll Wear Tomorrow
#Text=Check the weather .
#Text=Be sure to note how the weather will change throughout the day .
#Text=Perhaps it will start cold in the morning and heat way up by the end of the day .
#Text=Decide what layers you ’ll need to be comfortable all day long .
#Text=Take into account your commute .
#Text=If you walk or take public transportation you might be warm by the end of your commute and want to be able to take off a couple of layers of clothes to cool down .
#Text=You should also be sure to wear comfortable shoes so your feet are n’t already hurting you by the time you get to work .
#Text=Accessorize .
#Text=If you ’ll be out in the sun , bring a hat .
#Text=Is it going to rain ?
#Text=Put an umbrella by the front door so you do n’t forget it in the morning .
#Text=Are you going out after work ?
#Text=Bring a briefcase use can store your tie in or pack with some blingy jewelry to spruce up your work clothes for evening wear .
#Text=Try on your outfit .
#Text=Be sure everything fits and makes you feel good .
#Text=This way you ’ll avoid having to make any last minute changes that keep you from heading out the door on time .
#Text=Planning out Your Day
#Text=Make a to-do list .
#Text=Write down everything you need to do in the morning .
#Text=Do n’t make the list too long or complicated , just write down the essentials .
#Text=You ’ll be able to move through each task efficiently without forgetting anything .
#Text=Mark your priorities .
#Text=Note which things need to be done that day or addressed soon .
#Text=Note which things can be done later and which can be delegated to someone else .
#Text=Concentrate on getting those most important tasks done first .
#Text=Give yourself enough time .
#Text=Note estimates of how long each item will take you to complete .
#Text=Be sure not to underestimate and add some extra time to allow for unforeseen delays .
#Text=Try out an app .
#Text=Using a program like google calendar , wunderlist , or todoist helps you keep a digital copy of your obligations and appointments at the ready .
#Text=You can set reminders to keep yourself on track .
#Text=Plan meals ahead .
#Text=Many meals can be prepared the night before , to save you time cooking the next day .
#Text=For breakfast , cut up fruit and mix it with a squeeze of lemon to keep it fresh during the night .
#Text=Mix in yogurt .
#Text=In the morning , add granola and enjoy !
#Text=Lunch can be leftovers .
#Text=When you cook dinner , double the recipe .
#Text=Eat the extra for lunch the next day or freeze it to eat for another dinner on a super busy day .
#Text=Dinner can be prepared in the crockpot .
#Text=For example , put boneless chicken breasts with a little chicken stock in a crockpot to cook on low while you are at work .
#Text=When you get home , add rice and salad for an easy dinner .
#Text=Keep easy ready-to-go snacks , like apples , on hand .
#Text=You can also portion out snacks like nuts and dried fruits so that you can grab them on your way out the door in the morning .
#Text=Tidy as you work .
#Text=Once you ’ve completed a task , clean up before starting the next one .
#Text=For example , you ’ve finished a presentation .
#Text=Put away all the presentation materials and files you ’ve used before opening up files for your upcoming conference all .
#Text=You will save yourself time later by not having to sort through many things to put away and file .
#Text=This will also help you focus more fully on each task at hand .
#Text=Make adjustments .
#Text=Try your new routine for three weeks .
#Text=If it ’s working for you , great !
#Text=If not , readjust the tasks you do and the time you get up until your days run more smoothly .
